column4: I get "composite sync not supported" and graphics effects don't work anymore. What should I do?
I get "composite sync not supported" and graphics effects don't work anymore. What should I do?
sorry
fuck it, I'm going to reinstall the system. The Ubuntu support IRC network sucks hard.
ban me.
whats the issue ? I just arrived
I get "composite sync not supported" and graphics effects don't work anymore.
ok  which video card do you have?  in terminal    lspci | grep -i vga
00:02.0 VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation Mobile GM965/GL960 Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 0c)
oh darn let me see if that is because of something reported  I heard  hold on
did this start happening after installing lucid  or after lucid updates?
let's say after lucid updates. yesterday it worked fine.
ok what have you done so far for troubleshooting including reboot ?
rebooted several times, booted with an older kernel image and initrd. none solved the problem.
and wise_crypt  let me try to find the report on this... a change was made by ubuntu to not allow composite on certain intel stuff  hold on

the only thing I can think of is the "block" put on some intel video chips to prevent effects especially compiz from working   I dont know of a fix other than going back to karmic  which I am about to do myself  because of 3 major bugs.... other than that   I dont have any other troubleshooting procedures to offer
I also cannto find the bug report on this even asked the fellow who made the changes to ubuntu
could you tell me how to "unblacklist" it, at least?
sorry about that I hit the wrong button
np. is there any way to roll back updates?
ah good question...  I dont use apptitude at all but I believe via aptitude you can do this... i know there are people here more qulaified to answer that question ..
